column4: Could someone help me set up a USB KVM switch to work with my ubuntu laptop and my winxp desktop?

KVM switches (if they're not made by idiots) don't require drivers or anything. Just hook up the switch to each machine as if there was no switch, connect your monitor, keyboard, and mouse to the switch, and it'll just work
And you only have one monitor connected?

yeah it was an easy setup however when I switch to my laptop(ubuntu) my laptop screen stays the same and my primary monitor that it should be using just acts as a second monitor to ubuntu, blank workspace but still shows the top panel
yes just 1 monitor, unless you count the laptop monitor, would that cause an issue ?
Ah, it's a laptop. Go to System -> Preferences -> Monitor and enable "Same image on all monitors"
The built-in display counts as a separate display
thx, got it workin, would I be able to close my laptop now and keep this working ?
how do I make it so when I close the lid/screen on my laptop it doesnt log out/hibernate, etc ?
System -> Preferences -> Power Management. Change "When laptop lid is closed" to "Blank screen" on both tabs
I might be digging a bit deep here, but now that I have that working. is there anyway to have my primary monitor display ubuntu in a diff resolution ?
because on my laptop where ubuntu is installed its set up for a laptop resolution, can I have it be 1280 x 1024 since I am now viewing it from my desktop monitor ?
No. If you mirror screens, you have to have the resolution the same on both monitors. How the heck could it draw the same thing in two resolutions?
If the laptop mirror also supports your desktop monitor's resolution, you can use that. Or you can make the desktop monitor the primary monitor and the laptop one secondary
